intro: Chilita angelensis, commonly known as the Angel's Chilita, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
